definition: to cut or chop into very small pieces
to subdivide minutely, to damage by cutting up
examples: The director minced up the play.

definition: to utter or pronounce with affectation
examples: minced the word in the manner of the old lady

definition: to restrain (words) within the bounds of decorum
examples: minced no words in stating his dislike

definition: to walk with short steps in a prim affected manner
examples: The comedian minced across the stage.

definition: small chopped bits (as of food), mincemeat
